bibl.title: Letter from Alberto Recio to Philip Showalter Hench, April 22, 1941

div1.p: Recio praises Hench for his historical research on the yellow fever story. He enthusiastically supports the memorialization of the Camp Lazear site and feels it will be greatly appreciated by future generations. He offers to enlist the support of high Cuban government officials.

div1.head: Letter from Alberto Recio to Philip Showalter Hench, April 22, 1941
div1.opener:
REPUBLICA DE CUBA
----
SECRETARIA DE SANIDAD Y BENEFICENCIA
--------
DIRECTOR DE SANIDAD
----
Havana, April 22d., 1941.
Dr. Philip S. Hench.
Mayo Clinic.
Rochester, Minn.
My dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
I have read with great interest
your excellent synopsis on the work done in Cuba by
the United States Yellow Fever Board from May 1900
to February 1901 which successfully proved Finlay's
discovery on the transmission of yellow fever by the
mosquito but in so doing one of its most distin-
guished member, Dr. Jesse Lazear, offered his life
in its prime youth as a sad tribute to Science.

As I know from what I have read and heard from
my teachers and from reliable witnesses of that pe-
riod, I find most accurate everything you say, in
the same way as your investigations on the exact
spot where Camp Lazear was located is absolutely
convincing, being therefore proved that the place
indicated as such by Dr. Alvaré and myself corres-
ponds to the yellow fever ward which you correctly
identify now as the spot where Dr. Lazear died.

I second most enthusiastically your suggestion
to honor the memory of Dr. Finlay, the U. S. Army
Yellow Fever Board, Jesse W. Lazear the martyr and
those brave volunteers who offered themselves for
those famous experiments which culminated in bringing
under control one of mankind's worst plagues. Marking
the sites where these great things happened and pre-
serving the spots and documents which we possess is
an undertaking which will be greatly appreciated by
future generations.

I am endeavoring to enlist the support of the Mi-
nister of Health and other high government officials
towards the noble ideas which you propose and as soon
as I have more concrete news I shall have pleasure in
letting you know them.
